Key Match Events: The Texas Rangers won their first World Series title after a 4-1 series win over the Arizona Diamondbacks.
Marcus Semien hit a two-run home run in the ninth inning to seal the victory.
The Rangers extended their lead in the ninth inning to take the title.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy, the manager of the Texas Rangers, won his fourth World Series crown.
Corey Seager, the shortstop for the Texas Rangers, was named series MVP.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers had started life as the Washington Senators in 1961 but had never won a World Series before.
The Rangers moved to Texas in 1972.
Others: The game was played at Chase Field in Phoenix, Arizona.
